reviewText:
SERIOUS NOTE - This game only works on some computers. I'm not sure why, so please be careful if you're considering on purchasing this game.

Seriously, this is one of the best Disney game I've ever played! And one of the best driving games I’ve ever played :D
I love this game!
The game is about Lightning McQueen and Cars.

The graphics are great. Quite appealing if you ask me. The town looks amazing with a lot of cars roaming around town, the best part is smashing into them and watching them fly and say funny quotes! The town looks like how you would expect it to look in the film. The characters look accurate to what they look like in the film which is pretty cool. The voice acting was totally awesome and pretty funny. For example, as McQueen overtakes a racer, he says objects in the mirror may be closer than they appear"
date: that cracked me up!\n\nThe game has free roam (best Disney Cars game IMO)
recommended: you can drive as Lightning McQueen around 3 different areas including Radiator Springs
hoursPlayed:
what I enjoy doing is ramming into other cars and watching them fly while they say funny things xD
Free roam is pretty much calm and fun to explore!

The story doesn't really cover the film's story
voteText: it's kind of based on what happened after the story
helpfulPercent: so if you haven't watched the film then this game has got some spoilers for you. Spoilers
votesHelpful: get it? The wing on the back of a car...?\n\nThere are a lot of fun tracks to race on and a variety of characters to choose from
votesFunny: and a bunch of paint jobs to customise them with. The characters have different stats like top speed
column16: handling etc. The characters' personalities fit perfectly to the film
column17: and they do make races lively with funny and memorable quotes: Like McQueen’s "KA-CHOW!" phrase xD   He says it in different ways
column18: he shouts it and whispers it and some of them sound funny to me.\nThe bad thing about character selection is that there are some cars (like Luigi
column19: Sarge and Fillmore etc.) who can race with you
column20: but you can't race as them
column21: so that kinda sucks :(\n\nThere are fun mini games added to the side
column23: where you have to wake up tractors without waking up getting caught by Frank
column25: where you have to pursuit cars while they are moving fast. They are harder than they sound
column26: but they are enjoyable. The bad part is that they are too long and take too much time
column27: like around 10-15 minutes.\n\nThere are also Piston Cup races
column28: each being 12 laps around. There is also a pit stop mini game with Guido as he changes the tires and refuels the car. But you could only play as the race cars in Piston Cup races
column30: or Chick Hicks and Doc Hudson etc. not Mater or Ramone (lol) But I guess it makes sense
column31: hence it being a Piston Cup race.\n\nNow onto the important part
column32: the gameplay. The cars drive at different speeds and the drifting is handy
column33: although it doesn't look like the drifting in the film
column34: hence the "turn right to go left" quote. The wheel still goes in the direction you want to go
column35: so the car just looks like it's making a hard turn instead of actually drifting. The gameplay is really fun
column36: smooth and easy to master each track with various shortcuts.\nHowever sometimes the car decides to flip and go upside down if you try to crash yourself
column37: it sounds funny and it makes up for it because it is funny lol.  Making contact with other racers will make your car slower which isn't what I'd expect from a racing game
column38: but they do talk after collision which is a good thing.\n\nThis game has controller support
column39: so you can play 2 player split-screen multiplayer with your friend
column40: which is a pretty fun addition.\n\nThis game is friendly towards kids alright? So don't go wrecking other cars lol
column41: because they don't show damage marks like scratches or dents.\n\nOr if you want to get straight into the action
column42:
use cheat codes to unlock all characters and race tracks and there you have it :D
btw there are other cheats like unlimited boost which is fun!

The soundtrack is amazing by the way
column43: like awesome tracks from Bruno Coon and great music like "Here I Am" by the Explosion
column44: and "Free Ride" from Edgar Winter Group
column45: the soundtrack is addictive so listen to it if you dare XD\n\nThe only bad thing about this PC version (Steam version
column46: not on consoles) is the lighting at night.\nBecause the game is old and wasn't really updated
column47: when playing mini games and races in night
column48: it's too dark to see or drive
column49: which is annoying and is preventing me from fully completing the game. So I hope that gets fixed soon...\n\nThe game is pretty and awesome
column50: quite classic! The graphics are pretty good for a 2006 game. I first played it on PS2 and was addicted to it due to its awesomeness! I recommend this to any Cars fan
column51: or racing fan. Because this game is fun!"

reviewText:
This game works perfect for me. I was worried first then I saw all the bad comments but i really wanted to play my old childhood game so took a risk i guess. But before you buy it you should look in the description if you have all the minimum  stuff installed.

Also I remember a cheat code to unlock all the tracks and cars :)

cheat code : IF900HP

reviewText: This game is just as good as I remember, and now I can play it at high resolution! You might remember that I have a playlist on YouTube of (almost) all the music in this game. Ask me for a link if you want.\n\nThe only issues I have are the keyboard controls, but I suppose I could plug in a Gamecube or something else controller. Maybe.

reviewText:
Here's what I did with this game;
1) I saw it on sale and it made me look back at the good PS2 days when I was 9.
2) After a long time, I decided to buy it
3) After downloading it I realized it didn't work (as most of the community reported with the same problem)
4) I started crying (just saying, I didn't literally cry) because I couldn't play this awesome game.
5) I took my PS2, and played it.

This game is splendid but the Steam version is just useless. Don't buy this (Unless they fix the problem, which is more likely to be impossible)
PS2 version 9.5/10
PC version -3/10
voteText: 29 of 53 people (55%) found this review helpful 7 people found this review funny

reviewText:
So far no crashes. I have been running it in adim with the old compatablity mode. So if you are wondering does this work. Well mine does on a 4790k,980ti, 16gig ram, and Win 10.
Game play is good and is an upgrade to the consoles unlike Cars 2.
Graphics are older but ok However! This game runs at 30fps with no option to turn it off and crashing into things always gives a slight pause in the hub world. You should check out Mater National if you are interested in this. Most of the game is the same but it does not support widescreen. Though it is 60fps! with much better textures. More hub world and new tracks. I perfer over this older verion.
That being said the story and racing is all very good. The hub world is also a nice touch.
I still recommend this game because it is fun. And that is the most important thing.

reviewText: Played the game with my son about 8 years ago and we both loved it. Pure nostalgia. Alas, the game does not work on Steam. Can't quite figure out how Steam can distribute a game that does not work on their platform.\n\nI refunded the game and got my money back - I'd rather have the game, though.

reviewText:
7.9/10

Awesome game from my childhood
New characters
Music was fun and bouncy
Races were intense
Room to improve
Overworld was huge

Animations weren't the best
Voice actors weren't the best (But were the originals in the movie!)
Driving controls felt sluggish
